intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. nephromorphus, commonly known as the kidney-shaped buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with numerous stamens. This subspecies is native to the eastern United States, particularly in moist, woodland habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its foliage and flowers are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance.
